wikipedia_page.main: John Edward Cornwallis Rous, 2nd Earl of Stradbroke (13 February 1794 – 27 January 1886) was a British soldier and nobleman.

response: Rous was the second son of John Rous, 1st Earl of Stradbroke, and was educated at Westminster School, and Dr. Burney's Academy. His elder brother was John Rous, 2nd Earl of Stradbroke, and his half-sister married Vice-Admiral Sir Henry Hotham.
*John Rous, 2nd Earl of Stradbroke 19 January 1844 – 27 January 1886

He was born on 19 November 1862, the only son and heir of John Rous, 2nd Earl of Stradbroke. Under the courtesy title of Viscount Dunwich, he was educated at Harrow School and at Trinity College, Cambridge (Bachelor of Arts 1884, Master of Arts 1890). He succeeded his father as the 3rd Earl of Stradbroke and owner of the family seat at Henham Park in Suffolk on 27 January 1886.

link_mentions.page: John Edward Cornwallis Rous, 2nd Earl of Stradbroke

response: Monday 10 March 1890 was the 32nd birthday of Lady Augusta Fane, eldest daughter of John Rous, 2nd Earl of Stradbroke, and she was dining at the Old Club in Melton Mowbray with 25 people, the men in red coats and white breeches, the hunting set. Latecomers stood around the walls. She was attractive, and all were drawn by an exciting and different evening ahead. A few days before, Augusta had chosen a novel and fun way of celebrating the event. There was to be a full moon on Monday, so she suggested a Moonlight Steeplechase, and the idea was immediately seized upon and what was needed was decided.David Bowles and Gillian Lane, The Midnight Steeplechase Part 1; The Midnight Steeplechase Part 2, local-history.org.uk

He married first, 24 June 1835, Isabella Mary, youngest daughter of Admiral Sir Eliab Harvey, G.C.B.; she died at Rolls Park, Chigwell, on 15 December 1838; and secondly, on 7 September 1841, Harriet Anne, only daughter of Admiral the Hon. Sir Henry Blackwood, baronet; she died on 31 December 1869. They had a London home at 4 Upper Brook Street, Mayfair. By his first wife Fane had no issue. By his second wife he had two daughters, Cicely Harriette Fane (1846 – 1933) and Blanche Anna Fane (1847 – 1935), and a son, Cecil Francis William (1856-1914) who married 8 May 1880 Lady Augusta Fanny Rous (1858 – 1950), daughter of John Rous, 2nd Earl of Stradbroke.
Covin married, on 26 June 1895, Lady Gwendoline Audrey Adeline Brudenell Rous (1869–1952), daughter of John Rous, 2nd Earl of Stradbroke and Augusta Bonham.
*John Rous, 2nd Earl of Stradbroke (1794–1886), British aristocrat
